results.title: O.J.: Made in America
results.creator_credit: Libby Geist, Deirdre Fenton, Nina Krstic, Caroline Waterlow, Connor Schell, Ezra Edelman, ESPN Films and Laylow Films
results.brief_description: A chronicle of the rise and fall of O.J. Simpson, whose high-profile murder trial exposed the extent of American racial tensions, revealing a fractured and divided nation.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI’s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during America’s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Libby Geist, Deirdre Fenton, Nina Krstic, Caroline Waterlow, Connor Schell, Ezra Edelman, ESPN Films and Laylow Films

results.title: MLK/FBI
results.creator_credit: Dedalus Wainwright, Sheila Griffin, Benjamin Hedin, Kate Hurwitz, Brian Becker, Laura Tomaselli, Sam Pollard, IFC Films and Field of Vision
results.brief_description: Based on newly declassified files, the film explores the US government’s surveillance and harassment of Martin Luther King, Jr.

results.title: Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer
results.creator_credit: Betty Orr, Trish Wood, Michael Kot, Saloon Media and Amazon Studios
results.brief_description: After years of silence, Ted Bundy’s long-term girlfriend Elizabeth Kendall, her daughter Molly, and other survivors come forward for the first time in a docuseries that reframes Bundy’s crimes from a female perspective. The series reveals how Bundy’s pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and the feminist movement of the 1970s in one of the most infamous crime stories of our time.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Betty Orr, Trish Wood, Michael Kot, Saloon Media and Amazon Studios

results.title: Visible: Out On Television
results.creator_credit: David Bender, David Permut, Tripod Media, Push It Productions, Permut Presentations and Apple Video Programming, LLC
results.brief_description: Explore the history of the LGBTQ movement through the lens of TV in this five-part docuseries. Combining archival footage with new interviews, it looks at homophobia, invisibility, the evolution of LGBTQ characters, and coming out in the TV industry.

results.title: Collective
results.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania which kills dozens.
description_for_label: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania which kills dozens.

results.title: [Remix: ACMI Collection]
results.brief_description:
“Some of the thousands of stories in our collection.” This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to the gems in the ACMI Collection. A remix of home movies and short works from the collection featuring children and families, fashion models, road trips, city streets and swimming pools.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Boort Historical Society, Tony Agapitos, Jenny & Owen Peake, John Richardson, Karen Wootton, Daniel Scharf, Frank & John Straford, Ivan Gaal and The Gadsden Family.

results.title: [Remix: Hats]
results.brief_description:
This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to hats and how we wear them. A remix of home movies and short works in the ACMI Collection featuring styles, shapes and fabrics of hats. Whether at the beach, riding a horse, driving a racing car or going for a swim, a fashionable head-covering is a must. Australian fashion’s best styles of hats for men, women and children from the 1930s to the 1980s are shown.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Tony Agapitos, Karen Wootton, The Gadsden Family, Elenor Peach, Karen Corry, Jenny & Owen Peake, Gil Brealey & Paul Olson and John Richardson.

results.title: [Remix: Sunnies]
results.brief_description:
Worn at the beach or on a bush walk, or simply as a style statement, this playful short film is a tribute to the fashion accessory, and sun-smart, sun glasses. Set to a boss nova soundtrack, this short work is a tribute to ‘shades’, showing people wearing sun glasses cut from home movies and short works in the ACMI Collection. Featured are some of fashion’s best styles of eye wear from the 1940s to the 1970s.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office; Elenor Peach; Barry Parsons; The Gadsden Family and Neville Daley.

results.title: Flash Back: ACMI Collections Mash-up White Night 2017
results.brief_description:
‘Flash Back’, an archival mashup of films and footage from the 1940s through to the ‘80s celebrating the changing face of Australian youth identity and culture.

From rebel youth of the ‘50s, to the ‘70s counter culture revolution and the punk attitudes of the ‘80s, ‘Flash Back’ explores the changing decades through diverse subcultures and the music, fashions and cultural preoccupations that shaped them.

Image: ‘Sharpies: A Gathering’, courtesy Greg Macainsh

Our sincere thanks to filmmakers, musicians and donors for material used in this work. Full details in credits. Edited by ACMI’s Sam Mapplebeck.

results.title: Return of the Sacred Kingfisher Festival 2000
results.brief_description: Each November since the Sacred Kingfisher was seen again in the Merri Creek environment, a festival has been held at CERES Community Environment Park to celebrate the return of this native bird to the area as part of its seasonal migration. The festival, with the participation of local schools and communities, also celebrates the cleanup and revegetation of the Merri Creek environs, and the work of CERES in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick East.
